result.execSummary:
The defendant Cara L Zech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  To be paid by 6/23/2015 or to serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive to any other sentence.  Straight time.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Straight time.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that her  voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until her  civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cara L Zech

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for missed payments.  10 days HOC, consecutive.   Due & owing
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant has filed a request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs and surcharges of this action.  The Court has reviewed the defendant's submission and grants the request - the fine, costs and surcharges shall be paid on or before December 1, 2015.  The defendant shall make monthly payments of at least $50 by the 1st of each month.  The first payment is due paid by July 1, 2015.  If the defendant makes monthly payments and the full amount is not paid by December 1, 2015, the defendant may request additional time. - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.

Defendant Cara L Zech in court with attorney Robert N Meyeroff.  Defendant Cara L Zech in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  To be served straight time.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/23/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full, and court will grant.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Robert N Meyeroff in court, defendant Cara L Zech not in court, in custody.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Cara L Zech in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Cara L Zech in custody.  Karl Hayes for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cara L Zech in court with Student Intern Nicole Murphy under the supervision of attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Cara L Zech in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
